events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application to cover unexpected medical expenses with full documentation.
The loan application was categorised as a personal loan based on the stated purpose of covering medical bills and personal debt.
A loan officer was assigned to the personal loan application to provide personalized support throughout the review process.
The initial review focused on the applicant’s stated reason for the loan and verified submitted identity and income documents.
Additional documents were requested from the applicant, including recent bank statements and proof of medical expenses.
The applicant promptly submitted the requested documents including medical bills and bank statements for further verification.
A credit check was performed to assess the applicant’s creditworthiness and history for the personal loan request.
The risk assessment was completed, showing moderate risk due to current debt levels but reasonable repayment capacity.
A loan offer was presented including terms and interest rates tailored for the applicant’s requested personal loan amount.
The applicant responded positively, requesting a small adjustment to the repayment schedule to better fit their budget.
The application was escalated to senior underwriting to review the requested repayment schedule modifications and risk.
Following the senior review, the personal loan application was approved considering the applicant’s updated terms request.
The approved loan amount was funded and disbursed to the applicant's bank account for covering medical and personal expenses.
A follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant understood the loan terms and to answer any additional questions.
The personal loan application process was officially closed after successful funding and a confirmed follow-up with the applicant.
